intro: Tinnea lanuginosa, commonly known as the downy tinnea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Tinnea lanuginosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
